item.description:
It's time for the last FREE classical music concert for the spring season at the NEC!

Tonight, maestro Hugh Wolff, the NEC's Calderwood Director of Orchestras, wraps up the spring season with Debussy's classic La Mer and the Bartok Violin Concerto No. 2.  Student violinist Kobi Malkin '12, winner of NEC's concerto competition, joins the orchestra for the Bartok.  Works from Ligeti and Adès will also be performed.

For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/nec-philharmonia-wolff-2 

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the back full row of the center floor section, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find. However, if the balcony is open, I try to grab a section on the left side as it affords a really good view of the orchestra, it's easier to seat a large group there, and the acoustics are still amazing.

Note: Due to Meetup's recent terrible decision to remove the Maybe option, please indicate whether you are a maybe in your Yes RSVP. (and please write to Meetup here if you want to register your displeasure with that decision!)

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Ligeti: Concert Românesc  (listen to the 4th movement here)
  • Bartok: Violin Concerto No. 2 (listen to the beginning of the 1st movement here)
  • Adès: Dances from Powder Her Face
  • Debussy: La Mer (listen to the 1st movement here)
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series Finale: Wolff conducts Debussy, Bartok & others
